The concept of a Giffen good is limited to very poor communities with a very limited choice of goods. Suppose you have a very low income and eat two basic foodstuffs rice and meat. Meat is a luxury and is much more expensive than rice. If rice increased in price, your disposable income is effectively reduced significantly. Therefore, with a reduction in disposable income – you buy less meat. To compensate for less meat, you buy more rice to gain enough calories.

Question 59
Redeemable preference shares of Rs. 2,00,000 are to be redeemed at par for which fresh equity shares of Rs. 80,000 are issued at a discount of 10%. What amount should be transferred to Capital Redemption Reserve Account?
  • A.Rs. 2,00,000
  • B.Rs. 1,20,000
  • C.Rs. 1,28,000
  • D.Rs. 72,000
Correct Answer: Rs. 1,28,000

Face value of Preference shares to be redeemed = Rs. 2,00,000

 

Net Amount of fresh equity issued for the redemption of preference shares = Rs. 80,000 – (80,000×10%) = Rs. 80,000 – Rs. 8,000 = Rs. 72,000

 

Remaining amount of preference shares to be redeemed out of profits = Rs. 2,00,000 – Rs, 72,000 = Rs. 1,28,000.

 

As per the provision of Companies Act of 2013, an amount equal to the face value of preference shares redeemed out of profits must be transferred to the Capital Redemption Reserve account. Capital redemption reserve account can only be utilized to pay fully paid up bonus shares.

 

Thus, the amount to be transferred to capital redemption reserve account in this case = Rs. 1,28,000.

Question 60
Match List-I with List-IIList-IList II(a) Interbank call market(i) Money Market(b) Commercial bills(ii) Promissory note(c) Commercial papers(iii) Short-term maturity(d) Treasury bills(iv) Government papersChoose the correct option from those given below:
  • A.(a)-(i); (b)-(ii); (c)-(iv); (d)-(iii)
  • B.(a)-(iii); (b)-(i); (c)-(ii); (d)-(iv)
  • C.(a)-(i); (b)-(iii); (c)-(iv); (d)-(ii)
  • D.(a)-(iv); (b)-(iii); (c)-(ii); (d)-(i)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii); (b)-(i); (c)-(ii); (d)-(iv)
Question 61
Which of the following does NOT come under the definition of ‘information’ as per the Right to Information Act (RTI Act), 2005?
  • A.Logbooks
  • B.Data material held in electronic form
  • C.File noting
  • D.Circular
Correct Answer: File noting

‘File noting’ does not come under the definition of ‘information’ as per the Right to Information Act (RTI Act), 2005. The said Act defines ‘information’ as follows:

 

Information means any material in any form, including records, documents, memos, e-mails, opinions, advices, press releases, circulars, orders, logbooks, contracts, reports, papers, samples, models, data material held in any electronic form and information relating to any private body which can be accessed by a public authority under any other law for the time being in force.

Question 62
Which of the following are included in digital payment system?(a) RTGS(b) Demand draft(c) NEFT(d) ChequeChoose the correct option from the following:
  • A.(a), (c) and (d)
  • B.(b) and (d) only
  • C.(a) and (c) only
  • D.(b), (c) and (d)
Correct Answer: (a) and (c) only

Only RTGS and NEFT are included in digital payment system among the options given in the question.

 

National Electronic Funds Transfer (NEFT) is a nation-wide payment system facilitating one-to-one funds transfer. Under this Scheme, individuals, firms and corporates can electronically transfer funds from any bank branch to any individual, firm or corporate having an account with any other bank branch in the country participating in the Scheme. NEFT is an electronic fund transfer system that operates on a Deferred Net Settlement (DNS) basis which settles transactions in batches. In DNS, the settlement takes place with all transactions received till the particular cut-off time. These transactions are netted (payable and receivables) in NEFT whereas in RTGS the transactions are settled individually. For example, currently, NEFT operates in hourly batches. Any transaction initiated after a designated settlement time would have to wait till the next designated settlement time Contrary to this, in the RTGS transactions are processed continuously throughout the RTGS business hours.

 

The acronym ‘RTGS’ stands for Real Time Gross Settlement, which can be defined as the continuous (real time) settlement of funds transfers individually on an order by order basis (without netting). ‘Real Time’ means the processing of instructions at the time they are received rather than at some later time; ‘Gross Settlement’ means the settlement of funds transfer instructions occurs individually (on an instruction by instruction basis). Considering that the funds settlement takes place in the books of the Reserve Bank of India, the payments are final and irrevocable.

Question 63
Which among the following is NOT included in negotiable instrument?
  • A.Cheque
  • B.Demand Draft
  • C.Promissory Note
  • D.Mutual Fund
Correct Answer: Mutual Fund

‘Mutual Fund’ is not included in negotiable instrument.

 

The law relating to negotiable instruments is contained in the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881. It is an Act to define and amend the law relating to promissory notes, bills of exchange and cheques. The term “negotiable instrument” means a document transferable from one person to another. However the Act has not defined the term. It merely says that “A negotiable instrument” means a promissory note, bill of exchange or cheque payable either to order or to bearer.

 

According to this definition, the following are the conditions of negotiability:

(i) The instrument should be freely transferable. An instrument cannot be negotiable unless it is such and in such state that the true owner could transfer by simple delivery or endorsement and delivery.

(ii) The person who takes it for value and in good faith is not affected by the defect in the title of the transferor.

(iii) Such a person can sue upon the instrument in his own name.

Question 64
  • A.This choice was deleted after the attempt was started.
Correct Answer:
Question 65
Consider the following.Assertion-A:U-shaped long-run average cost curve is based on the assumption that economies of scale prevails at small levels of production and diseconomies of scale prevails at larger level of production.Reason-R:Decreasing returns to scale arises primarily because as the scale of operation increases, it becomes even more difficult to manage the firm effectively.In the context of the above two statements, which one of the following codes is correct?
  • A.Both A and R are correct and R is the right explanation of A
  • B.Both A and R are correct and R is not the right explanation of A
  • C.A is correct and R is not incorrect
  • D.Both A and R are correct
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is not the right explanation of A

The U-shape of the short-run average cost curve is explained with the law of variable proportions. But the shape of the long-run average cost curve depends upon the returns to scale. It is because of the increasing returns to scale (economies of scale) in the beginning that the long-run average cost of production falls as output is increased and, likewise, it is because of the decreasing returns to scale (diseconomies of scale) that the long-run average cost of production rises beyond a certain point. Therefore, assertion A is correct. As the firm increases its scale of operation, it becomes difficult for the firm to manage operations effectively as a result decreasing returns operates. Therefore, reason (R) is also correct but as a statement but is not the correct explanation behind the U-shape of the long run average cost curve.

Question 66
Match List-I with List-IIList IList II(a) Ind AS-16(i) Income Tax(b) Ind AS-38(ii) Leasing(c) Ind AS-17(iii) Intangible Assets(d) Ind AS-12(iv) Property, plant and equipmentChoose the correct option from those given below:
  • A.(a)-(iv); (b)-(iii); (c)-(i); (d)-(ii)
  • B.(a)-(iv); (b)-(iii); (c)-(ii); (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(iii); (b)-(ii); (c)-(iv); (d)-(i)
  • D.(a)-(iv); (b)-(ii); (c)-(i); (d)-(iii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iv); (b)-(iii); (c)-(ii); (d)-(i)

The correct matching is given below.

(a) Ind AS-16 - (iv) Property, Plant, and Equipment

(b) Ind AS-38 - (iii) Intangible Assets

(c) Ind AS-17 - (ii) Leases

(d) Ind AS-12 - (i) Income Taxes

Question 67
‘Doctrine of Caveat Emptor’ means:
  • A.buyer should make payment well in time
  • B.buyer should be beware of all aspects of buying
  • C.buyer will be responsible for the whole payment
  • D.buyer will not be responsible at any cost
Correct Answer: buyer should be beware of all aspects of buying

The correct answer is option (B) – buyer should be beware of all aspects of buying.

 

The doctrine of Caveat Emptor is a legal principle that translates to "Let the buyer beware." Under this principle, the buyer is responsible for examining and assessing the quality and suitability of the goods or property before making a purchase. In other words, it implies that the seller is under no obligation to disclose any defects or issues with the product, and it is the buyer's responsibility to ensure that they are satisfied with the purchase. This principle places the burden of due diligence on the buyer to avoid being misled or deceived in the transaction.

Question 68
Which of the following is true about India Trade Policy (Export-Import) 2015-2019?(a) Doubling the exports (both merchandise and services)(b) Achieve 3.5% share in global exports(c) Introduced two new schemes (MEIS and SEIS)(d) Introduced simplified Aayat-Niryat FormChoose the correct answer from the following:
  • A.(a) and (b) only
  • B.(a) and (c) only
  • C.(a), (b) and (c) only
  • D.All are correct
Correct Answer: All are correct

The 5 year Foreign Trade Policy, 2015-20 provides a framework for increasing exports of goods and services as well as generation of employment and increasing value addition in the country, in keeping with the “Make in India” vision of Prime Minister.  The focus of the new policy is to support both the manufacturing and services sectors, with a special emphasis on improving the ‘ease of doing business.

 

FTP-2015-20. introduce two new schemes, namely “Merchandise Exports from India Scheme (MEIS)” for export of specified goods to specified markets and “Services Exports from India Scheme (SEIS)” for increasing exports of notified services, in place of a plethora of schemes earlier, with different conditions for eligibility and usage. In order to give a boost to exports from SEZs, government has now decided to extend benefits of both the reward schemes (MEIS and SEIS) to units located in SEZs.

 

One of the major objectives of new FTP is to move towards paperless working in 24 × 7 environment.  Recently, the government has reduced the number of mandatory documents required for exports and imports to three, which is comparable with international benchmarks.  Now, a facility has been created to upload documents in exporter/importer profile and the exporters will not be required to submit documents repeatedly.  Attention has also been paid to simplifying various ‘AayatNiryat’ Forms, bringing in clarity in different provisions, removing ambiguities and enhancing electronic governance.

 

“Approved Exporter System” will help these manufacturer exporters considerably in getting fast access to international markets.

 

‘NiryatBandhu Scheme’ has been galvanized and repositioned to achieve the objectives of ‘Skill India’.

Question 69
The social environment of the job affects people and is also affected by them and not by management alone, is the main proposition of
  • A.contingency theory of organization
  • B.system theory of organization
  • C.classical theory of organization
  • D.Neo-classical theory of organization
Correct Answer: Neo-classical theory of organization
Question 70
Amount unutilized in capital gain account scheme for which exemption claimed u/s 54 shall be treated as long-term capital gain, if
  • A.2 years have expired from the date of transfer
  • B.2 years have expired from the date of deposit
  • C.3 years have expired from the date of transfer
  • D.3 years have expired from the date of deposit
Correct Answer: 3 years have expired from the date of transfer

Option C is the correct answer.

Question 71
List out from the given statements the important ethical principles that a business should follow:(a) To take the necessary action for the development of the concerned industry or business.(b) Pay taxes and discharge other obligations promptly.(c) To ensure the best utilization of the human resources.(d) Refrain from secret kickbacks or pay-offs to customers, suppliers, administrators, etc.(e) Ensure payment of fair wages and fair treatment of employees.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:Codes
  • A.(c), (d) and (e)
  • B.(b), (d) and (e)
  • C.(a), (b) and (c)
  • D.(a), (c) and (e)
Correct Answer: (b), (d) and (e)

Business ethics can be defined as, “The study of proper business policies and practices regarding potentially controversial issues, such as corporate governance, insider trading, bribery, discrimination, corporate responsibility and fiduciary responsibilities.”

 

Upholding certain values and moral principles is important to the success and longevity of a business because poor ethics can harm the organization’s culture, lower the retention rate and bad relationships within as well as outside the organization.

 

Some examples of important ethical principles that a business should follow include:

1) Honesty

2) Integrity

3) Integration

4) Trustworthiness (Refrain from secret kickbacks or pay-offs to customers, suppliers, administrators, etc)

5) Compliance (Pay taxes and discharge other obligations promptly)

6) Responsibility (Pay taxes and discharge other obligations promptly)

7) Fairness (Ensure payment of fair wages and fair treatment of employees)

8) Loyalty (Refrain from secret kickbacks or pay-offs to customers, suppliers, administrators, etc)

(The list is not limited to just these principles)

Question 72
If two regression coefficients are – 0.8 and – 0.2, then the value of coefficient of correlation is:
  • A.-0.16
  • B.-0.50
  • C.+0.40
  • D.-0.40
Correct Answer: -0.40

xy × byx.

 

Where, bxy and byx are the two regression coefficient

 

Putting values in the formula we get,

r = 0.40

 

Question 73
Redressal mechanism for consumer disputes under Section 9 of the Consumer Protection Act envisages a:
  • A.single-tier system
  • B.two-tier system
  • C.three-tier system
  • D.open system independent of hierarchy
Correct Answer: three-tier system

Under the Section 9 of the Consumer Protection Act 1986, there is provision of a 3 tier machinery for Redressal of Consumer Disputes:

(i) District Forum

(ii) State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission

(iii) National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission

Question 74
Consider the following.Statement I:If the tax liability has been reduced within the legal framework, it is tax planning.Statement II:If tax liability has been reduced to get benefit of deduction available under the income tax, it is called tax evasion.In the context of the above two statements, which one of the following codes is correct?
  • A.Both the Statements I and II are correct
  • B.Statement I is correct but II is incorrect
  • C.Both Statements I and II are incorrect
  • D.Statement II is correct but I is incorrect
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct but II is incorrect

Statement I is correct but II is incorrect.

 

Tax planning refers to all the activities undertaken to minimize tax liabilities within the legal framework, ensuring that available allowances, deductions, exclusions, and exemptions are utilized in the most tax-efficient manner to reduce the total tax liability for a company. These strategies are typically employed to help businesses achieve their financial and business goals. Tax planning can involve various tactics, such as lowering taxable income, reducing the tax rate, controlling when taxes are paid, and maximizing available tax relief or credits.

 

It's crucial to distinguish between tax avoidance and tax evasion. Tax evasion occurs when a taxpayer deliberately fails to disclose accurate or complete information or defrauds the state by violating legal provisions. It's considered unethical and illegal. Tax avoidance, on the other hand, involves reducing tax liability by utilizing legal provisions and strategies. It's about minimizing taxes without breaking the law. However, effective tax avoidance requires a thorough understanding of tax laws and relevant legal decisions, as well as awareness of other statutes affecting taxation.

Question 75
Promoting team spirit, harmony and unity within in the organization is the principle of:
  • A.order
  • B.scalar chain
  • C.spirit de corps
  • D.equity
Correct Answer: spirit de corps

The correct answer is option (C) - spirit de corps.

 

Esprit de corps is a French term that translates to "spirit of the body" or "team spirit." It refers to the sense of unity, camaraderie, and morale among members of a group or organization. Promoting team spirit, harmony, and unity within an organization is aligned with the principle of "esprit de corps." This principle emphasizes the importance of fostering a positive work environment where employees feel connected, supported, and motivated to work together towards common goals. Building strong team spirit can enhance collaboration, productivity, and overall organizational success.

Question 76
Consumer behavior does NOT consist which of the following activities?
  • A.Obtaining
  • B.Consuming
  • C.Disposition
  • D.Producing
Correct Answer: Producing

Consumer Behaviour is defined as activities people undertake when obtaining, consuming, and disposing of products and services.

 

Three primary activities are included in the definition of consumer behaviour – obtaining, consuming, and disposing.

(i) Obtaining refers to the activities leading up to and including the purchase or receipt of a product. Some of these activities include searching for information regarding product features and choices, evaluating alternative products or brands, and purchasing.

(ii) Consuming means how, where, when, and under what circumstances consumers use products. For example, issues relating to consumption might include decisions about whether the consumers use products at home or at the office.

(iii) Disposing refers to how consumers get rid of products and packaging. Consumer analysts might examine consumer behaviour from an ecological standpoint: How do consumers dispose of product packaging or product remains?

 

Producing a product for consumer’s use is a producer’s or manufacturer’s job.

Question 77
Which one is NOT true regarding the Market Stabilization Scheme (MSS)?
  • A.It absorbs surplus liquidity of enduring nature arising out of large capital flows.
  • B.It absorbs surplus liquidity through sale of short-dated government securities and treasury bills
  • C.Mobilized surplus liquidity is held in the MSS account with the Reserve Bank of India
  • D.MSS account liquidity can be used for normal government expenditure of capital nature
Correct Answer: MSS account liquidity can be used for normal government expenditure of capital nature

Option D is the correct answer.

 

Market Stabilization scheme (MSS) is a monetary policy intervention by the RBI to withdraw excess liquidity (or money supply) by selling government securities in the economy. The MSS was introduced in April 2004.

 

MSS was launched to withdraw the excess liquidity in the system that was generated as a result of the RBI’s purchase of foreign currencies in the foreign exchange market. From 2002 onwards, there was huge inflow of foreign capital into India. This led to appreciation of rupee. Since appreciation is not good for exports, the RBI intervened in the foreign exchange market by buying dollars. To buy dollars, the RBI has to give rupees. In this way, high selling of rupees leads to excess liquidity (rupee) and thereby creating a potential for inflation. To overcome this situation, the RBI has sold government bonds on a general basis depending upon the volume of excess liquidity in the system. Here bonds go to financial institutions and money goes back to the RBI. This withdrawal of excess liquidity is called sterilization.

 

To carry out the MSS, the government lends its bonds or securities (MSBs) to the RBI. In this way, the RBI becomes a debtor to the government equal to the value of the MSBs. The money obtained under MSS should be kept with the RBI. It should not be transferred to the government. This is because, if it is transferred, government will spend the money in the economy thereby adding to liquidity.

Question 78
Organization structure that shows a unique combination of strategy, structure and management process is known as
  • A.free-form organization
  • B.virtual organization
  • C.network organization
  • D.horizontal organization
Correct Answer: network organization

Network Organization: It is an improvement over horizontal design. It is based on horizontal coordination and collaboration beyond the boundaries of the organization. It is totally free from the classical, hierarchical and functional structure of organization. Internet technology, advanced telecommunication and continuous globalization have made it possible to form a network that can link people, organizations and systems of the whole world. This type of organization can be formed by subcontracting firms’ major functions to separate enterprises and coordinating their activities from small headquarter organizations. BPO firms widely follow this type of organizational design. Miles and Snow, the organization theorists, identified this design and called it a dynamic network that shows a unique combination of strategy, structure and management process.

Question 79
Which among the following institutions is NOT a part of World Bank group?
  • A.International Development Association (IDA)
  • B.International Monetary Fund (IMF)
  • C.International Finance Corporation (IFC)
  • D.Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA)
Correct Answer: International Monetary Fund (IMF)

As you can see in World Bank Group logo above, it is a unique global partnership of five institutions working for sustainable solutions to achieve the mission of the twin goals of ending extreme poverty and building shared prosperity.

 

Following are the description of those 5 institutions:

1. The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD)

IBRD lends to governments of middle-income and creditworthy low-income countries.

2. The International Development Association (IDA)

IDA provides interest-free loans — called credits — and grants to governments of the poorest countries.Together, IBRD and IDA make up the World Bank.

3. The International Finance Corporation (IFC)

IFC is the largest global development institution focused exclusively on the private sector. We help developing countries achieve sustainable growth by financing investment, mobilizing capital in international financial markets, and providing advisory services to businesses and governments.

4. The Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA)

MIGA was created in 1988 to promote foreign direct investment into developing countries to support economic growth, reduce poverty, and improve people’s lives. MIGA fulfills this mandate by offering political risk insurance (guarantees) to investors and lenders.

5. The International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes (ICSID)

ICSID provides international facilities for conciliation and arbitration of investment disputes

Question 80
Which one of the following is used for international money transfer?
  • A.RTGS
  • B.NEFT
  • C.SWIFT
  • D.DD
Correct Answer: SWIFT

A fast way to transfer money is through a mechanism called SWIFT (Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication) wire transfer. This is an offline facility available with most banks in India, such as Axis, ICICI, Standard Chartered and ING Vysya, which are associated with those in other countries.

 

One is required to fill the beneficiary's details, such as bank account number, postal address of the bank and its SWIFT code, in a form. Once this is done, the amount will be debited from the person’s account and credited to the foreign bank account in 48-72 hours. If the bank does not provide this facility, one can get a demand draft made and give it to a bank which does.

Question 81
SUGAM is also known as
  • A.ITR-1
  • B.ITR-2
  • C.ITR-3
  • D.ITR-4
Correct Answer: ITR-4

ITR 4 Sugam (For Individuals, HUFs and Firms (other than LLP) being a resident having total income upto Rs. 50 lakh and having income from business and profession which is computed under sections 44AD, 44ADA or 44AE): Form ITR 4 needs to be filed by those who opt for presumptive income like professionals, doctors, film stars, etc. Even a businessman or a doctor or a professional with a turnover of less than Rs 2 crore can opt for ITR 4 under Section 44 AD of presumptive income with a declaration of profits. Income from Profession where such income is computed in accordance with special provisions referred to in sections 44ADA also opt for ITR 4. Consultants by profession like interior decorator, architect, technical or professional consultants who charge money for professional advice can also opt for this scheme

Question 82
Match List 1 with List IIList IList II(Trade and Finance Institution)(Headquarters)(a) WTO(i) Brussels(b) IMF(ii) Geneva(c) FAO(iii) Washington(d) EU(iv) RomeChoose the correct option from those given below:
  • A.(a)-(ii); (b)-(iii); (c)-(iv); (d)-(i)
  • B.(a)-(i); (b)-(ii); (c)-(iii); (d)-(iv)
  • C.(a)-(iii); (b)-(ii); (c)-(i); (d)-(iv)
  • D.(a)-(i); (b)-(iii); (c)-(ii); (d)-(iv)
Correct Answer: (a)-(ii); (b)-(iii); (c)-(iv); (d)-(i)

(a) WTO – Geneva

The World Trade Organization (WTO) is the premier global organization overseeing trade regulations among nations. Rooted in WTO agreements, ratified by most trading nations, its mission is to promote smooth, predictable, and free trade. Decisions are chiefly made by member governments, with ministers meeting biennially and ambassadors convening regularly in Geneva.

 

(b) IMF – Washington

Headquartered in Washington, D.C., the International Monetary Fund (IMF) comprises 189 countries dedicated to enhancing global monetary cooperation, ensuring financial stability, fostering international trade, advancing employment, sustainable economic growth, and alleviating poverty worldwide.

 

(c) FAO – Rome

Based in Rome, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) leads global efforts to combat hunger. It serves as a neutral platform for nations to negotiate and debate policies, provides expertise, and aids developing countries in modernizing agriculture, forestry, and fisheries, promoting nutrition and food security for all.

 

(d) EU – Brussels

The European Union (EU) is a political and economic union of 27 member states primarily situated in Europe. It operates a single internal market governed by standardized laws across member states. The EU focuses on facilitating the free movement of people, goods, services, and capital, while also coordinating policies on trade, agriculture, fisheries, and regional development.

Question 83
Building long-term mutually satisfying relations with key customers, suppliers, distributors in order to earn and retain their long-term preference and business is known as
  • A.relationship marketing
  • B.social marketing
  • C.niche marketing
  • D.service marketing
Correct Answer: relationship marketing

Relationship marketing has the aim of building long-term mutually satisfying relations with key parties – customers, suppliers, distributors – in order to earn and retain their long-term preference and business. Marketers accomplish this by promising and delivering high-quality products and services at fair prices to the other parties over time. Relationship marketing builds strong economic, technical and social ties among the parties. It cut down the transaction costs and time. The ultimate outcome of relationship marketing is the building of a unique company asset called a marketing network. A marketing network consists of the company and its supporting stakeholders (customers, employees, suppliers, distributors, retailers, ad agencies etc.) with whom it has built mutually profitable business relationships.

Question 84
Which of the following is the predecessor of the IRDA Act, 1999?
  • A.The Insurance Act, 1938
  • B.The Life Insurance Corporate Act, 1956
  • C.The Marine Insurance Act, 1963
  • D.The Public Liability Insurance Act, 1991
Correct Answer: The Insurance Act, 1938

Earlier to the Insurance Act, 1938, the insurance business was carried by the insurance companies in accordance with the principles of the Company Law 1913. When the business started growing, the need for an independent law to regulate the insurance business was noticed and a separate Act, the Insurance Act, 1938 was legislated. The Act was used for all purposes relating to both life and general insurance businesses and their regulations. With regards to general insurance, this Act is being used to regulate the marine insurance, fire insurance and other insurances. Further growth of business has made it complex and more legal provisions were required to regulate it. The Marine Insurance Act, 1963, Public Liability Insurance Act, 1991, Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority Act, 1999 and regulations made by the IRDA are some of the legislations that govern the insurance business.

Question 85
Which of the following are NOT sources of secondary data?(a) Interview(b) Questionnaire(c) Observation(d) Unpublished thesis(e) Annual ReportChoose the correct option from the following:
  • A.(a), (d) and (e)
  • B.(b), (c) and (d)
  • C.(c), (d) and (e)
  • D.(a), (b) and (c)
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (c)

The correct answer is option (D) – (a), (b), and (c).

 

Secondary data refers to information that has been previously collected and processed by someone other than the researcher. It includes sources such as books, journals, newspapers, reports, websites, and other published materials.

 

(a) Interview: Interviews involve direct interaction with individuals to gather primary data, making them a source of primary data rather than secondary data.

(b) Questionnaire: Similar to interviews, questionnaires are a means of collecting primary data directly from respondents.

(c) Observation: Observational studies involve firsthand observation of phenomena, making them a primary data collection method rather than a source of secondary data.

Question 86
Under which of the following situations, economies of scale exists to the potential and persists?
  • A.When firm is too small and too specialized
  • B.When firm’s decision to hire inputs do not result in an increase in the input costs
  • C.When firm is too large and over-diversified
  • D.hen long-run cost of producing a unit falls as the output increases
Correct Answer: hen long-run cost of producing a unit falls as the output increases

Economies of scale refers to the situation where, as the quantity of output goes up, the cost per unit goes down. Once a firm has determined the least costly production technology, it can consider the optimal scale of production, or quantity of output to produce. Many industries experience economies of scale. In everyday language: a larger factory can produce at a lower average cost than a smaller factory.

Question 87
Peter F. Drucker noted the relationship between selling and marketing in which of the following terms?
  • A.Marketing is a subsidiary component of selling
  • B.The aim of marketing is to make selling superfluous
  • C.The aim of selling is to make marketing superfluous
  • D.Selling and marketing are essentially the same thing
Correct Answer: The aim of marketing is to make selling superfluous

The managerial definition of Marketing presented by Peter F. Drucker is – The aim of marketing is to know and understand the customer so well that the product or service fits him and sells itself. Marketing has often been described as “the art of selling products.” But according to Peter Drucker, the aim of marketing is to make selling superfluous. Ideally, marketing should result in a customer who is ready to buy.

Question 88
Shopping goods have which of the following features?(a) These products are generally durable in nature(b) Consumers generally compare the goods of various sellers and then buy such goods(c) Per unit price of these goods is generally high(d) These goods are regularly and continuously in demand(e) These goods are sold as a result of aggressive promotional effortsChoose the right answer from the options given below:
  • A.(c), (d) and (e)
  • B.(a), (b) and (c)
  • C.(b), (c) and (d)
  • D.(a), (c) and (e)
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (c)

The correct answer is (B) (a), (b), and (c).

 

Shopping goods, also known as shopping products, possess several distinct features that set them apart from other types of consumer goods. These features include:

 

(a) Durability: Shopping goods can indeed be durable in nature, but this is not a defining characteristic of this category. While some shopping goods may be durable, others may not necessarily fall into this category.

 

(b) Comparison Shopping: One of the key features of shopping goods is that consumers often engage in comparison shopping before making a purchase. They assess various attributes such as quality, price, and style among different options before making a decision.

 

(c) Higher Unit Price: Shopping goods often have a higher per-unit price compared to convenience goods. This higher price reflects the perceived value or quality associated with shopping goods and the consideration consumers put into their purchase decisions.

 

(d) Continuous Demand: Unlike convenience goods, which are purchased frequently and regularly, shopping goods are bought less frequently but still on a regular basis. However, the continuous demand for shopping goods is not as pronounced as for convenience goods.

 

(e) Aggressive Promotional Efforts: While promotional efforts may play a role in the marketing of shopping goods, it is not necessarily a defining feature of this category. Promotion strategies may vary depending on the specific product and market dynamics.

Question 89
The current market price of a company’s share is Rs. 90 and the expected dividend per share next year is Rs. 4.5. If the dividend is expected to grow at a constant rate of 8%, the shareholder’s required rate of return will be
  • A.8%
  • B.5%
  • C.20%
  • D.13%
Correct Answer: 13%

Ke = D1NP + g

 

Where,

Ke = Cost of Equity Capital or Shareholder’s required rate of return

D1= Expected Dividend per Share at the end of the year

NP = Net Proceeds per equity share

g = Rate of Growth in dividends

D0 = Previous year’s dividend

 

Given, D1= Rs. 4.5, NP= Rs. 90, g= 8%= 0.08

Putting all the values in the formula we get,

 

Ke = 4.590 + 0.08

= 0.05 + 0.08

= 0.13 or 13%

Question 90
A firm consumes 90000 units of a certain item of raw material in its production process annually. It costs Rs. 3 per unit, the cost per purchase order is Rs. 300 and the inventory carrying cost is 20% per year. What is the EOQ?
  • A.9470 units
  • B.9487 units
  • C.9480 units
  • D.9840 units
Correct Answer: 9487 units

EOQ = 2×D×SH

where,

D = Annual demand / consumption

S = Cost of placing an order

H= Inventory carrying cost of one unit per annum.

Given, D = 90000 units, S = Rs. 300, H = 20% of Rs. 3 = 0.6

Pulling these values in the formula we get,

EOQ = 2×90000×3000.6 = 9486.83

EOQ = Approx. 9487 units

Question 91
Which of the following characteristics are related to relationship marketing?(a) Product feature orientation(b) Product benefit orientation(c) Frequent consumer contact(d) High concern for qualityChoose the correct option from the following:
  • A.(b), (c) and (d)
  • B.(a), (b) and (c)
  • C.(a), (c) and (d)
  • D.(a), (b) and (d)
Correct Answer: (b), (c) and (d)

Relationship marketing is a customer-centric approach that prioritizes building and maintaining long-term relationships with customers. It involves fostering a deep connection with customers based on trust, satisfaction, and mutual benefit.

Question 92
Consider the following.Assertion A:According to Net Income (NI) approach, capital structure decision is relevant in the valuation of firm.Reason R:A firm can change its total value and its overall cost of capital by change in the degree of leverage in its capital structure.In the context of the above two statements, which one of the following options is correct?
  • A.Both A and R are correct and R is the right explanation of A
  • B.Both A and R are correct and R is not the right explanation of A
  • C.Both A and R are incorrect
  • D.A is correct and R is not correct
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the right explanation of A

Net Income Approach suggested by the Durand. According to this approach, the capital structure decision is relevant to the valuation of the firm. In other words, a change in the capital structure leads to a corresponding change in the overall cost of capital as well as the total value of the firm. According to this approach, use more debt finance to reduce the overall cost of capital and increase the value of firm

Question 93
Following are the events of an organizational culture:(a) Customer orientation and employee policies(b) Quality orientation, directing and motivating styles(c) Decision-making, products and services and responsibilities to society(d) Reaction to competitors and gratitude towards nation(e) Role ambiguities, trade union and policiesSelect the correct sequence for the above events:
  • A.(a), (b), (d) and (e)
  • B.(a), (c), (d) and (e)
  • C.(b), (c), (d) and (e)
  • D.(a), (b), (c) and (d)
Correct Answer: (a), (b), (c) and (d)

Trade Union and Policies are not related to Culture of organization. All other options are related to steps, used to build organizational culture.

Question 94
Match List-I with List-II.List I (Objectives of business firms)(a) Maximization of firm’s growth rate(b) Managerial utility function(c) Satisfying behaviour(d) Sales MaximizationList II (Hypothesis)(i) Baumol’s hypothesis(ii) Marris hypothesis(iii) Williamson hypothesis(iv) Cyert-March hypothesisChoose the correct option from those given below
  • A.(a)-(ii); (b)-(iii); (c)-(iv); (d)-(i)
  • B.(a)-(iii); (b)-(iv); (c)-(i); (d)-(ii)
  • C.(a)-(iv); (b)-(i); (c)-(ii); (d)-(iii)
  • D.(a)-(i); (b)-(ii); (c)-(iii); (d)-(iv
Correct Answer: (a)-(ii); (b)-(iii); (c)-(iv); (d)-(i)

The correct answer is (A) (a)-(ii); (b)-(iii); (c)-(iv); (d)-(i).

 

Baumol’s hypothesis (d): W.J. Baumol explored the implications of an alternative objective for firms, focusing on maximizing the value of sales (total revenue) while ensuring that profits do not fall below a minimum acceptable level. This hypothesis suggests that firms may prioritize maximizing sales revenue rather than solely focusing on profit maximization.

 

Marris hypothesis (b): Marris proposed a theory based on the separation of goals between owners (shareholders) and managers within firms. While shareholders typically aim for profits and market share, managers seek better salary, job security, and growth opportunities. Marris suggests that these divergent goals can be reconciled by pursuing balanced growth, where the growth rate of demand for the firm's products aligns with the growth rate of capital supply to the firm.

 

Williamson hypothesis (iii): Williamson's theory emphasizes managerial utility maximization as opposed to profit maximization. In modern large firms, shareholders and managers often have different objectives. While shareholders seek maximum returns on investment, managers are motivated by factors such as salary, job security, and discretionary funds. Williamson's hypothesis focuses on maximizing the utility of managers, which includes considerations beyond profit maximization, such as expenditure on staff and discretionary funds.

 

Cyert-March hypothesis (i): Cyert and March proposed a theory based on the concept of satisficing rather than maximizing outcomes. According to this hypothesis, real firms aim to achieve satisfactory outcomes rather than striving for the best possible results. Satisficing entails making decisions that meet an acceptability threshold rather than maximizing profits or other relevant metrics. This approach is rooted in bounded rationality, where decision-makers exhibit prudent behavior under given circumstances.

Question 95
A company issues 10% irredeemable preference shares. The face value per share is Rs. 100, but the issue price is Rs. 95. What is the cost of preference shares?
  • A.10.63%
  • B.10.73%
  • C.10.83%
  • D.10.53%
Correct Answer: 10.53%

Cost of preference capital is given by:

Kp= PdNP

Where,

Kp = Cost of preference Capital

Pd = Preference dividend

NP = Net Proceedings from preference shares

Given, Pd = 10% of 100 = Rs. 10, NP = Rs. 95

Putting these values in the formula we get,

Kp = 10/95 = 0.10526

Kp = 10.53%

Question 96
Which one of the following analyses is suitable for risk-return analysis in financial decisions?
  • A.CAPM analysis
  • B.SWOT analysis
  • C.Capital gearing
  • D.EVA analysis
Correct Answer: CAPM analysis

CAPM analysis: The Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM) describes the relationship between systematic risk and expected return for assets, particularly stocks. CAPM is widely used throughout finance for pricing risky securities and generating expected returns for assets given the risk of those assets and cost of capital.

 

SWOT (strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats) analysis is a framework used to evaluate a company's competitive position and to develop strategic planning.

 

Capital Gearing: is a British term that refers to the amount of debt a company has relative to its equity.

 

EVA analysis: In corporate finance, as part of fundamental analysis, economic value added is an estimate of a firm's economic profit, or the value created in excess of the required return of the company's shareholders.

Question 97
Consider the following.Statement I:The arithmetic mean is an all-purpose average.Statement II:Median and mode are called positional averages.In the context of the above two statements, which one of the following codes is correct?
  • A.Both the statements I and II are correct
  • B.Both the statements I and II are incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct but II is incorrect
  • D.Statement II is correct but I is incorrect
Correct Answer: Both the statements I and II are correct

The correct answer is (A) Both the statements I and II are correct.

 

Statement I: The arithmetic mean, commonly known as the average, is indeed considered an all-purpose average for various statistical purposes. It is often preferred unless there is a specific reason to consider another type of average. The arithmetic mean offers several advantages, including its suitability for algebraic treatment and its sampling stability. When data is homogeneous and does not exhibit wide variations, the arithmetic mean is a reliable measure of central tendency. For instance, it is commonly used to report average height, average scores, or average income within a homogeneous group.

 

Statement II: Median and mode are indeed referred to as positional averages because they are based on the position of observations within a dataset arranged in ascending or descending order.

 

Median: As a positional average, the median is the value that divides a dataset into two equal parts, with one part containing values greater than the median and the other containing values less than the median. While the median may not be suitable for algebraic treatment like the arithmetic mean, it is preferred in situations where extreme values are present or when averaging qualitative phenomena.

 

Mode: Similarly, the mode, another positional average, represents the most frequently occurring value in a dataset. It is a simple descriptive measure of central tendency that is not influenced by extreme values. While it may not have rigid mathematical properties like the arithmetic mean, the mode is valuable in practical situations such as market studies, where identifying the most common value is essential.

Question 98
Study the following information:Covariance between X and Y series = -17.8Standard deviation of X series = 6.6Standard deviation of Y series = 4.2No. of pairs of observation = 20The coefficient of correlation is
  • A.– 0.642
  • B.0.642
  • C.0.253
  • D.– 0.253
Correct Answer: – 0.642

Coefficient of Correlation, r = cov(X, Y)SX×SY

Where, cov(X,Y) = covariance between X and Y

SX = Standard deviation of X

SY = Standard deviation of Y

Given, cov(X,Y) = -17.8, SX = 6.6, SY = 4.2

Putting these values in the formula we get,

 

r = -17.86.6×4.2

 

r = -0.642

Question 99
Which one of the following is NOT the pre-requisite of price discrimination?
  • A.Firm must have monopoly power
  • B.Product has multiple close substitutes and different uses
  • C.Markets are separated and segmented
  • D.Price elasticity of product must differ in different markets
Correct Answer: Product has multiple close substitutes and different uses

The correct answer is (B) Product has multiple close substitutes and different uses.

 

Price discrimination refers to the practice of charging different prices for the same product or service in different markets or to different customers. Successful price discrimination relies on specific conditions being met:

 

Market Segmentation: The firm must be able to identify distinct market segments with different levels of demand elasticity or willingness to pay. These segments could be based on factors such as geographic location, demographics, or usage patterns.

 

Differential Price Elasticities: Each market segment must exhibit different price elasticities of demand. This means that consumers in one segment are more responsive to price changes than those in another segment. Price discrimination becomes feasible when the firm can charge higher prices to customers with less elastic demand (i.e., those less sensitive to price changes) and lower prices to customers with more elastic demand.

 

Market Separation: The markets must be effectively separated to prevent arbitrage, which occurs when buyers purchase a product at a lower price in one market and resell it at a higher price in another market. Market separation can be achieved through various means, such as geographic distance, time-based pricing (dynamic pricing), or product differentiation.

 

No Arbitrage: There should be mechanisms in place to prevent the resale of products across different market segments at different prices. If arbitrage opportunities exist, price discrimination may not be sustainable.

 

Monopoly Power: While not always a strict requirement, some degree of market power or monopoly power is often necessary for successful price discrimination. Monopoly power allows the firm to exert control over pricing and exploit price differences across market segments

Question 100
The arithmetic mean of 10 items is 50. If each item is increased by 5, then new arithmetic mean would be
  • A.50
  • B.55
  • C.60
  • D.45
Correct Answer: 55

The formula for arithmetic mean is X_ = ∑XN

Where, X_ = Arithmetic Mean, ∑X = Sum of observations and N = No. of observations

 

Suppose, the original mean (before adding 5 to observations)let’s sayX_ = 50 and N = 10, therefore

∑X = X_× N

∑X = 50 × 10 = 500

Now, the sum total of all the observations that is∑X after adding 5 to each observation will get increased by 50 (10 × 5), hence the new ∑X will be 550 (500 + 50).

 

So, the new mean will be X_ = 55010 = 55

Quiz Attempt #119000

Total Questions: 100
Question 1
Cardinal utility analysis of consumer’s behaviour is based on which combination of the following assumptions?(i) Utility is measurable in terms of cardinal numbers.(ii) Constancy of the marginal utility of money.(iii) Utilities of different goods are interdependent.(iv)Gossen’sfirst law of consumption.Choose the correct answer from the code given below:Code:
  • A.Only (i), (ii) and (iv)
  • B.Only (iii) and (iv)
  • C.Only (ii), (iii) and (iv)
  • D.Only (i) and (ii)
Correct Answer: Only (i), (ii) and (iv)

Cardinal utility analysis of consumer’s behaviour is based on:

(i) Utility is measurable in terms of cardinal numbers.

(ii) Constancy of the marginal utility of money.

(iv) Gossen’s first law of consumption.

 

Cardinal Utility is used to analyze consumer behaviour and preferences. It is based on the concept of utility, which represents the satisfaction or happiness a consumer derives from consuming a good or service.

Question 2
Match the items of List I with the items of List II and choose the correct answer from the code given below.List I(a) Rival Firms(b) Technology(c) Improving Quality(d) Ethics in BusinessList II(i) External Environment(ii) Social and Cultural Environment(iii) Internal Environment(iv) Global EnvironmentCodes
  • A.(a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)
  • B.(a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)
  • C.(a)-(ii), (b)-(iii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
  • D.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iii), (b)-(i), (c)-(iv), (d)-(ii)

The correct match is given below.

 

(a) Rival Firms - Internal Environment

(b) Technology –External Environment

(c) Improving Quality - Global Environment

(d) Ethics in Business - Social and Cultural Environment

Question 3
Given is the information related to a house:Municipal Value (M.V) Rs.1,50,000Fair Rent Rs.1,80,000Standard Rent Rs.1,60,000Actual Rent Rs.20,000 pmMunicipal tax paid by owner is 20% of M.V. Unrealised rent RS.40,000(conditions of rule 4satisfied). What is the annual value of the house?
  • A.RS. 2,10,000
  • B.RS. 1,60,000
  • C.RS. 1,50,000
  • D.RS. 1,70,000
Correct Answer: RS. 1,70,000

Computation of Annual Value of the house

Amt. (in Rs)

Working Note:

 

 

 

(a) Municipal Value

1,50,000

 

 

(b) Fair Rent

1,80,000

 

 

(c) Actual Rent (Rs. 20,000 × 12)

2,40,000

 

 

(d) Higher of (a), (b) and (c)

 

2,40,000

 

(e) Actual Rent

2,40,000

 

 

(f) Standard Rent

1,60,000

 

 

(g) Higher of (e) and (f)

 

2,40,000

 

(h) GAV: lower of (d) and (g)

 

 

2,40,000

Less Municipal Taxes (20% of 1,50,000)

 

 

(30,000)

Less: Unrealised rent

 

 

(40,000)

Annual Value of the House

 

 

1,70,000

 

Question 4
Given below are two statements, one labelled as Assertion and the other labelled as Reason. Read the statements and choose the correct answer using the code given below.Assertion “A”:Technological change and skill requirements have been made a subject of investigation in an organization.Reason “R”:The neo-classical economic theory stated that technological changes require a broader variety of skills and higher average skills from the workers.Codes
  • A.Both A and R are incorrect.
  • B.A is correct but R is incorrect.
  • C.Both A and R are correct but R is not the right explanation of A.
  • D.Both A and R are correct and R is the right explanation of A.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct and R is the right explanation of A.

Both A and R are correct and R is the right explanation of A for the reason stated below:

 

Assertion (A) is correct. In modern organizations, technological change and its impact on skill requirements are indeed subjects of investigation and consideration. Organizations often analyze how technological advancements affect the skills needed by employees, training programs, recruitment strategies, etc.

 

Reason (R) is also correct. The neo-classical economic theory does state that technological changes lead to an increased demand for a broader variety of skills and higher average skills from workers. This is because new technologies often require workers to adapt, learn new tools, processes, and methods, which can necessitate a higher level of skills than previous job roles.

 

Relationship between A and R: The Reason (R) provides a valid explanation for why technological change and skill requirements are subjects of investigation in organizations. It explains that the neo-classical economic theory emphasizes the connection between technological advancements and the need for a more diverse skill set and higher average skills among workers. Therefore, A is correct, and R is the right explanation for A.

Question 5
Which one of the following is not the fund-based business of commercial banks?
  • A.RTGS/NEFT transactions
  • B.Acceptance of deposits
  • C.Overdraft facility
  • D.Issuance of letters of credit
Correct Answer: Issuance of letters of credit

Issuance of letters of credit is not the fund-based business of commercial banks.

 

The fund-based finance in banks is in different forms. The facilities like Overdrafts, Cash Credit A/c, Bills Finance, Demand Loans, Term Loans etc., wherein immediate flow of funds available to borrowers, are called funds-based facility. The non-fund based facilities like issuance of letter of guarantee, letter of credit wherein banks get fee income and there is no immediate outflow of funds from bank

Question 6
Choose the correct code for the following statements correct or incorrect.Statement I: An identifiable group of people contributing their efforts towards attainment of goals is called organization.Statement II: In its broadest sense, organization refers to the relationship between the various factors present in a given endeavour.Code:
  • A.Statement II is correct, but I is incorrect.
  • B.Statement I is correct, but II is incorrect.
  • C.Both the statements I and II are correct.
  • D.Both the statements I and II are incorrect.
Correct Answer: Both the statements I and II are correct.

Both the statements I and II are correct. According to McFarland, “Organisation is an identifiable group of people contributing their efforts towards the attainment of goals”.

 

According to Spriegel, “In its broadest sense, organization refers to the relationship between the various factors present in the given endeavour. Factory organization concerns itself primarily with the internal relationships within the factory such as responsibilities of personnel arrangement and grouping of machines and material control. From the standpoint of enterprise as a whole, organization is the structural relationship between various factors in an enterprise.”

Question 7
Choose the correct code for the following statements being correct or incorrect.Statement I: The geometric mean of the two regression coefficients of X and Y variables gives the value of the coefficient of correlation.Statement II: If the population distribution is not normal and a sampling distribution of mean is prepared by taking small sized samples, the sampling distribution of mean is not normal.Code:
  • A.Statement I is correct, but II is incorrect.
  • B.Both the statements I and II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement II is correct, but I is incorrect.
  • D.Both the statements I and II are correct.
Correct Answer: Both the statements I and II are correct.

The coefficient of correlation is the geometric mean of the two regression coefficients. Symbolically: r = bxy + byx

If X and Y are independent variables then coefficient of correlation is zero. However, the converse is not true.

Through the coefficient of correlation, we can measure the degree or extent of the correlation between two variables. On the basis of the coefficient of correlation we can also determine whether the correlation is positive or negative and also its degree or extent.

 

If the population distribution is not normal and a sampling distribution of mean is prepared by taking small sized samples, the sampling distribution of mean is not normal.

Question 8
Critical path indicates which one of the following?
  • A.Recorded time of completing a task
  • B.Average time of completing a task
  • C.Longest route of completing a task
  • D.Shortest route of completing a task
Correct Answer: Longest route of completing a task

Critical path indicates longest route of completing a task. The concept is explained below:

 

The critical path is the longest sequence of activities in a project plan which must be completed on time for the project to complete on due date. An activity on the critical path cannot be started until its predecessor activity is complete; if it is delayed for a day, the entire project will be delayed for a day unless the activity following the delayed activity is completed a day earlier. Most of the times, if such delay is occurred, project acceleration or re-sequencing is done in order to achieve the deadlines.

Question 9
Choose the correct code for the following statements being correct or incorrect.Statement I: Intellectual Property (IP) is a category of property that includes intangible creations of the human intellect.Statement II: IPR does not include trade secrets and moral rights.Code:
  • A.Both the statements I and II are correct.
  • B.Both the statements I and II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct, but II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement II is correct, but I is incorrect.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct, but II is incorrect.

Statement I is correct because Intellectual property (IP) refers to the creations of the human mind like inventions, literary and artistic works, and symbols, names, images and designs used in commerce.

 

Statement II is incorrect, as Intellectual property (IP) is a category of property that includes intangible creations of the human intellect, and primarily encompasses copyrights, patents, and trademarks. It also includes other types of rights, such as trade secrets, publicity rights, moral rights, and rights against unfair competition

Question 10
In which one of the following modes of entry into foreign market are risk and profit potential the highest?
  • A.Direct exporting
  • B.Joint ventures
  • C.Indirect exporting
  • D.Direct investment
Correct Answer: Direct investment

The mode of entry into a foreign market where risk and profit potential are typically the highest is (D) Direct investment.

 

Here's an explanation for each option and why direct investment tends to have the highest risk and profit potential:

 

Direct exporting (A): Involves selling products or services directly to a foreign market. While it may have lower risk compared to direct investment, the profit potential is also typically lower as the company may not have full control over distribution and marketing strategies in the foreign market.

 

Joint ventures (B): Involve partnering with a local company in the foreign market. Joint ventures can mitigate some risks by leveraging the local partner's knowledge and resources. However, the profit potential may vary depending on the terms of the joint venture agreement and the dynamics between the partners.

 

Indirect exporting (C): Occurs when products are sold to intermediaries who then export them to foreign markets. This method usually involves lower risk as the company doesn't directly engage with foreign markets. However, the profit potential may also be limited compared to direct investment.

 

Direct investment (D): Involves establishing a physical presence in a foreign market, such as setting up subsidiaries, branches, or acquiring local companies. Direct investment typically carries the highest risk due to factors like political instability, regulatory challenges, cultural differences, and substantial capital investment. However, it also offers the highest profit potential as the company gains full control over operations, distribution, pricing, and marketing strategies in the foreign market.

Question 11
For performance assessment of employees, “helping to meet legal requirements” is the application of which one of the following?
  • A.Organizational maintenance purpose
  • B.Developmental purpose
  • C.Administrative purpose
  • D.Documentation purpose
Correct Answer: Documentation purpose

For performance assessment of employees, “helping to meet legal requirements” is the application of Documentation purpose.

 

Performance appraisal is a part of performance management activities. This activity deals with career planning, rewards systems, goal setting and periodic performance appraisals of the employees. Performance appraisal is a systematic process of jointly assisting work related achievements, strength and weaknesses of the individual employees. This activity also helps to provide performance feedback to individuals and team to which the employees belong. Performance appraisal represents link between goal setting and reward setting.

 

Documentation: Criteria for Validation Research, Documentation for HR Decisions, Helping to meet Legal Requirements.

Question 12
Match the items of List I with the items of List II and choose the correct answer from the code given below.List I(a) The economy was characterized by small regional suppliers who sold goods on a local basis(b) Standardized, branded goods were sold at national level(c) Era of market differentiation based on demographic, socio-economic and life style factors(d) Technological advancements, especially in the area of digital communication, allow marketers to communicate with individual consumers or very small groupsList II(i) Mass marketing(ii) Hyper-segmentation(iii) Segmentation(iv) FragmentationCode:
  • A.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
  • B.(a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii), (d)-(ii)
  • C.(a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)
  • D.(a)-(i), (b)-(iv), (c)-(ii), (d)-(iii)
Correct Answer: (a)-(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii), (d)-(ii)

The correct answer is option B.

 

(a) The economy was characterized by small regional suppliers who sold goods on a local basis – Fragmentation (List II - iv)

Fragmentation refers to the concept that markets are not homogeneous and are composed of different segments based on needs, wants, responses, and behavior. As markets grow, they fragment into distinct sub-markets, forming potential market segments. Fragmentation reduces the effectiveness of mass media and brand loyalty.

 

(b) Standardized, branded goods were sold at a national level – Mass Marketing (List II - i)

Mass marketing involves attracting a large portion of the audience by focusing on a higher volume of sales at lower prices to obtain maximum exposure for the product. It is effective for products that appeal to a broad customer base and use broadcasting media for promotion.

 

(c) Era of market differentiation based on demographic, socio-economic, and lifestyle factors – Segmentation (List II - iii)

Segmentation involves dividing the market population into meaningful segments based on variables like demographics, geography, and psychographics. It helps companies target specific segments more accurately and design tailored marketing strategies.

 

(d) Technological advancements, especially in digital communication, allow marketers to communicate with individual consumers or very small groups – Hyper-Segmentation (List II - ii)

Hyper-segmentation allows pinpointing specific consumer segments through digital communication and data gathering techniques. Addressable marketing and progressive profiling are methods used for hyper-segmentation, enabling personalized communication with individual consumers or small groups.

Question 13
Which of the following is NOT the assumption of inverse relationship between the price and the quantity demanded?
  • A.incomeof consumer should remain the same.
  • B.no change in the scale of preference
  • C.no change in the price of substitute goods
  • D.Inflation Rate
Correct Answer: Inflation Rate

The assumption of an inverse relationship between price and quantity demanded is a fundamental concept in economics known as the law of demand. This law states that as the price of a good or service increases, the quantity demanded by consumers decreases, and vice versa, assuming all other factors remain constant.

 

Let's analyze each option to identify which one is NOT an assumption of the inverse relationship between price and quantity demanded:

 

(A) Income of consumer should remain the same: This is not an assumption of the law of demand. The law of demand focuses solely on the relationship between price and quantity demanded, assuming that other factors such as income can vary.

 

(B) No change in the scale of preference: This is also not an assumption of the law of demand. The law of demand does not address changes in preferences or tastes directly; it primarily focuses on the impact of price changes on quantity demanded.

 

(C) No change in the price of substitute goods: This is an assumption related to the law of demand. It assumes that the prices of substitute goods remain constant because changes in the prices of substitutes can affect the demand for a particular good.

 

(D) Inflation Rate: This is the correct answer. The assumption of the inverse relationship between price and quantity demanded does not directly consider the inflation rate. Inflation can influence both price and income levels, which can, in turn, affect the quantity demanded. However, the law of demand itself does not assume a specific inflation rate or consider inflation as a factor in the inverse price-quantity relationship.

Question 14
X Ltd. forfeited 40 shares of Rs.10 each and on which Rs.4 per share was paid. If the forfeited shares are reissued as Rs.8 per share paid up, what is the minimum price the company must charge?
  • A.Rs.2 per share
  • B.Rs.10 per share
  • C.Rs.4 per share
  • D.Rs.8 per share
Correct Answer: Rs.4 per share

Forfeiting Shares: When a shareholder fails to pay the remaining amount due on shares, the shares are forfeited. In this case, X Ltd. forfeited 40 shares of Rs.10 each, on which Rs.4 per share was paid. This means the shareholders initially paid Rs.4 per share, leaving Rs.6 per share unpaid.

 

Reissuing Shares: The forfeited shares are now being reissued at Rs.8 per share paid up. This means the new shareholders must pay Rs.8 per share.

 

To calculate the minimum price the company must charge, we need to consider the unpaid amount on the forfeited shares and ensure that the new price covers this unpaid amount. Since the initial share value was Rs.10 (Rs.4 paid + Rs.6 unpaid), and the reissued share value is Rs.8 paid up, the minimum price must cover the unpaid amount of Rs.6.

 

So, the correct answer is option (C) Rs.4 per share.

 

The company must charge a minimum price of Rs.4 per share to cover the unpaid amount from the forfeited shares. Anything less than Rs.4 per share would result in a loss for the company.

Question 15
A company proposes to introduce a new product in the market. The company wants to maintain P/V Ratio at 25%. If variable cost of the product is Rs.300, what will be the selling price?
  • A.RS.400
  • B.RS.100
  • C.RS.200
  • D.RS.300
Correct Answer: RS.400

The Profit/volume ratio, which is also called the ‘contribution ratio’ or ‘marginal ratio’, expresses the relation of contribution to sales and can be expressed as under:

 

P/V Ratio = Contribution/Sales

 

Since Contribution = Sales – Variable Cost = Fixed Cost + Profit, P/V ratio can also be expressed as:

 

P/V Ratio = Sales – Variable costSales

 

or, P/V Ratio = Fixed Cost + ProfitSales

 

 

or, P/V Ratio = Change in profit or ContributionChange in Sales

 

Therefore, according to the question, let the sale price be ‘X’

And substituting the values in the formula-

P/V Ratio = Sales – Variable costSales

 

0.25 = X – 300X

 

X = 3000.75

 

X= Rs. 400

 

The P/V ratio, which establishes the relationship between contribution and sales, is of vital importance for studying the profitability of operations of a business. It reveals the effect on profit of changes in the volume.

Question 16
According to Donald Kirkpatrick, training programmes can be evaluated at four levels. Indicate the code of correct sequence from the following:(i) Result(ii) Reaction(iii) Learning(iv) BehaviourChoose the correct answer from the code given below:Code:
  • A.(ii), (iii), (iv), (i)
  • B.(iv), (iii), (ii), (i)
  • C.(iii), (iv), (i), (ii)
  • D.(i), (ii), (iii), (iv)
Correct Answer: (ii), (iii), (iv), (i)

Kirkpatrick's Training Evaluation Model

Donald Kirkpatrick's 1975 book Evaluating Training Programs defined his originally published ideas of 1959, thereby further increasing awareness of them, so that his theory has now become the most widely used and popular model for the evaluation of training and learning. Kirkpatrick's four-level model is now considered an industry standard across the HR and training communities. The four levels of training evaluation model was later redefined and updated in Kirkpatrick's 1998 book, called "Evaluating Training Programs: The Four Levels".

 

The four levels of Kirkpatrick's evaluation model essentially measure:

1. Reaction: What trainee thought and felt about the training (how much they liked the training)

2. Learning: How much was increase in knowledge, attitudes, skills or capability

3.Behavior: Extent of behavior and capability improvement and implementation/application. Behavior outlines a relationship of learning (the previous measurement level) to the actualization of doing. Kirkpatrick recognized a big difference between knowing principles and techniques and using those principles and techniques on the job.

4. Results: Effects on the business or environment resulting from the trainee's performance, such as reduced costs, reduced turnover and absenteeism, reduced grievances, improved profits or morale, and increased quality and quantity of production

Question 17
Arrange the following stages of staffing in correct sequence and indicate the code of correct sequence.(i) Performance appraisal(ii) Recruitment(iii) Transfers(iv) Selection(v) Induction and orientationChoose the correct answer from the code given below:Code:
  • A.(ii), (i), (iv), (v), (iii)
  • B.(i), (ii), (iv), (v), (iii)
  • C.(iv), (ii), (v), (iii), (i)
  • D.(ii), (iv), (v), (i), (iii)
Correct Answer: (ii), (iv), (v), (i), (iii)

Staffing is concerned with recruitment, selection and placement. The correct sequence of staffing process is as follows:

(ii) Recruitment

(iv) Selection

(v) Induction and orientation

(i) Performance appraisal

(iii) Transfers

Question 18
Which one of the following demands states consumers are adequately buying all the products put into the marketplace?
  • A.Irregular demand
  • B.Overfull demand
  • C.Full demand
  • D.Latent demand
Correct Answer: Full demand

Irregular demand (A): This refers to demand that fluctuates irregularly due to various factors such as seasonal changes, changes in consumer preferences, or economic conditions. It doesn't imply that consumers are adequately buying all products.

 

Overfull demand (B): This occurs when demand exceeds supply, resulting in shortages or unmet customer needs. It implies that consumers want to buy more than what is available in the marketplace.

 

Full demand (C): This demand state indicates that consumers are adequately buying all the products put into the marketplace. There is a balance between supply and demand, and products are meeting the needs and wants of consumers without excess or shortage.

 

Latent demand (D): This refers to demand that exists but has not been expressed or realized due to various reasons such as lack of awareness, affordability issues, or unavailability of products. It doesn't necessarily imply that consumers are adequately buying all products in the marketplace.

Question 19
Given below are two statements, one labelled as Assertion and the other labelled as Reason. Read the statements and choose the correct answer using the code given below.Assertion “A”:The multilateral trading system is an attempt by governments to make the business environment stable and predictable.Reason “R”:Promising not to raise trade barriers can be as important as lowering one, because the promise gives businesses a clearer view of their future market opportunities.Codes
  • A.A is correct but R is incorrect.
  • B.Both A and R are incorrect.
  • C.Both A and R are correct and R is the right explanation of A.
  • D.Both A and R are correct but R is not the right explanation of A.
Correct Answer:

Both A and R are correct and R is the right explanation of A.

 

Assertion (A) is correct. The multilateral trading system, such as the World Trade Organization (WTO), is indeed an attempt by governments to create a stable and predictable business environment by promoting free trade, reducing trade barriers, and establishing rules and agreements for international trade.

 

Reason (R) is also correct. Promising not to raise trade barriers is important because it provides businesses with predictability and clarity regarding future market opportunities. This stability allows businesses to plan investments, expansion, and operations more effectively.

 

Relationship between A and R: The Reason (R) provides a valid explanation for why the multilateral trading system aims to create stability and predictability in the business environment. By committing to not raise trade barriers, governments contribute to a more certain and favourable climate for businesses, which supports the assertion that the multilateral trading system seeks to achieve stability and predictability.

Question 20
Which one of the following is NOT an advantage of external recruitment?
  • A.Scope for resentment, jealousies and heartburn are avoided
  • B.Benefits of new skills, new talents and new experiences to organizations are available
  • C.Compliance with reservation policy becomes easy
  • D.Good performance is rewarded
Correct Answer: Good performance is rewarded

The option D is not an advantage of external recruitment.

 

(A) Scope for resentment, jealousies, and heartburn are avoided: This is an advantage of external recruitment. When organizations bring in new employees from outside, it can reduce internal conflicts, resentments, and jealousy among existing employees who might compete for promotions or positions.

 

(B) Benefits of new skills, new talents, and new experiences to organizations are available: This is also an advantage of external recruitment. Hiring externally allows organizations to tap into a wider talent pool and bring in individuals with fresh perspectives, skills, and experiences that can benefit the organization.

 

(C) Compliance with reservation policy becomes easy: This is not necessarily an advantage of external recruitment. Compliance with reservation policies typically refers to affirmative action or diversity initiatives that require organizations to hire a certain percentage of employees from specific demographic groups. External recruitment may or may not make compliance easier, depending on the availability of candidates from the targeted groups in the external job market.

 

(D) Good performance is rewarded: This is not an advantage of external recruitment. Rewarding good performance typically relates to internal promotions, recognition, or incentives for existing employees who demonstrate high performance. External recruitment focuses on bringing in new talent rather than directly rewarding existing employees for their performance.

Question 21
The probable error of the coefficient of correlation “R” is calculated by which one of the following formulae?
  • A.0.67451-r2n
  • B.0.6745(1-r2)n
  • C.0.67451+r2n
  • D.0.6745(1+r2)n
Correct Answer: 0.6745(1-r2)n

The probable error (P.E) is the value which is added or subtracted from the coefficient of correlation “R” to get the upper limit and the lower limit respectively, within which the value of the correlation expectedly lies.

The probable error of correlation coefficient can be obtained by applying the following formula:

 

P.E.r = 0.6745 1- r2n

r = coefficient of correlation

n = number of observations

Question 22
Match the items of List I with the items of List II and choose the correct answer from the code given below.List I(a) Balance of Trade(b) Current Account(c) Balance of Payments(d) Capital AccountList II(i) Imports and exports of goods and services and unilateral transfer of goods and services(ii) Transactions leading to changes in the financial assets and liabilities of a country(iii) All economic transactions between a county’s residents and residents of other countries(iv) Value of exports and imports of a countryCodes
  • A.(iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii), (d)-(ii)
  • B.(a)-(iv), (b)-(iii), (c)-(ii), (d)-(i)
  • C.(a)-(i), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iii), (d)-(iv)
  • D.(a)-(iii), (b)-(ii), (c)-(iv), (d)-(i)
Correct Answer: (iv), (b)-(i), (c)-(iii), (d)-(ii)

(a) Balance of Trade: This refers to the value of exports and imports of goods. Therefore, it matches with (iv) Value of exports and imports of a country.

 

(b) Current Account: This includes imports and exports of goods and services, unilateral transfers, and income flows. Therefore, it matches with (i) Imports and exports of goods and services and unilateral transfer of goods and services.

 

(c) Balance of Payments: This includes all economic transactions between a country’s residents and residents of other countries. Therefore, it matches with (iii) All economic transactions between a country’s residents and residents of other countries.

 

(d) Capital Account: This includes transactions leading to changes in the financial assets and liabilities of a country. Therefore, it matches with (ii) Transactions leading to changes in the financial assets and liabilities of a country.

Question 23
Which one of the following is not the advantage of database management system?
  • A.Centralized control
  • B.Shared data
  • C.Improved data integrity
  • D.High acquisition costs
Correct Answer: High acquisition costs

Option A, B and C are positive while option D is a negative statement. The advantages and disadvantages of Database management system are explained below:

 

A database management system (DBMS) is a collection of programs that manages the database structure and controls access to the data stored in the database".

 

The DBMS serves as the intermediary between the user and the database. The database structure itself is stored as a collection of files, So, one can access the data in those files through the DBMS.

 

The DBMS receives all application requests and translates them into the complex operations required to fulfil those requests. The DBMS hides much of the database’s internal complexity from the application programs and users.

Question 24
Combined leverage can be used to measure the relationship between:
  • A.EBIT and EPS
  • B.Sales and EPS
  • C.PAT and EPS
  • D.Sales and EBIT
Correct Answer: Sales and EPS

Combined leverage can be used to measure the relationship between Sales and EPS.

 

A degree of combined leverage (DCL) is a leverage ratio that summarizes the combined effect that the degree of operating leverage (DOL) and the degree of financial leverage have on earnings per share (EPS), given a particular change in sales. This ratio can be used to help determine the most optimal level of financial and operating leverage to use in any firm. The Formula for the Degree of Combined Leverage is

 

DCL = (Percentage change in EPS)/Percentage change in sales = DOL × DFL

 

where:

DOL=Degree of operating leverage
